snippet: As the chancellor of the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill moves on, he raises some interesting questions about the management of college sports.
abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column discusses departure of Holden Thorp, chancellor of University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, whose largely successful tenure was overshadowed by ongoing athletic scandal; holds few college chancellors are prepared for managing bloated importance and corruption of college sports, which have become a $6 billion business.
lead_paragraph: As the chancellor of the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill moves on, he raises some interesting questions about the management of college sports.
